remarks: A way to show that an ordinal number equals the minimum of a collection of ordinal numbers: it must be in the collection, and it must not be larger than any member of the collection.  (Contributed by NM, 14-Nov-2003.)
statement:
oneqmini $p |- ( B C_ On -> ( ( A e. B /\ A. x e. A -. x e. B ) -> A = |^| B ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
